Subject: matlab windows installation - looking for Fortran libs?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=204994144
X-Yahoo-Profile: rahunt_xyz


I'm working on compiling Cantera from source on a Windows XP machine
with cygwin.  I am using the instructions in the win32 directory that
does not require Fortran ( see here:
http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/cantera/win32/README?view=markup ).

Unfortunately, when I get to the "make win" step, in which matlab is
opened and mex is run to compile ctmethods.dll, I get errors about
looking for dll's and lib files in the FORTRAN directory.

I found some of the DLL's  such as DFORMD.DLL available on-line, so
was able to move past those errors. I am stuck now with
LINK : fatal error LNK1181: cannot open input file
'C:/MATLAB7/bin/win32/dformd.lib' 
(My configuration file has Fortran_Lib_Dir="C:/Matlab7/Bin/Win32")

Any ideas on what step I am missing?  Is this not actually a Fortran
lib? If not, are there any thoughts on where I might find it (it
doesn't seem to live on my machine; I do not have Fortran installed).
 Otherwise, how can I modify my setup so that it does not require this
file?  
Thanks in Advance,
R
